titles.title: Florida National Forest Land Management Act of 2003
A bill to authorize the Secretary of Agriculture to sell or exchange certain land in the State of Florida, and for other purposes.
Florida National Forest Land Management Act of 2003
Florida National Forest Land Management Act of 2003
Florida National Forest Land Management Act of 2003
Florida National Forest Land Management Act of 2003
Florida National Forest Land Management Act of 2003

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Domenici without amendment. With written report No. 108-5.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 13.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Department Operations, Oversight, Nutrition and Forestry.
Mr. Putnam moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 117.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: House Agriculture
committee.subcommittee: Commodity Markets, Digital Assets, and Rural Development

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Florida National Forest Land Management Act of 2003 - Authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture to sell or exchange specified land in Florida. Requires the concurrence of the Secretary of the Air Force with respect to the sale or exchange of certain parcels of such land.
